OnlyFans Niche Ideas 2023: What Kind of Content is on OnlyFans?

OnlyFans Niche Ideas 2023: What Kind of Content is on OnlyFans?

70% of OnlyFans content is of the NSFW “not safe for work” type.

Why Many Fail with OnlyFans

Estimated Reading Time: 2 min 12 sec

Often when content creators start out on OnlyFans, they’re more concerned with earning a fat paycheck at the end of the month and reaching that top earner’s rating. However, they soon find out it’s not as easy, especially if they’re not utilizing the help of an agency. They’re soon hit by the OnlyFans creator’s pitfall by making a series of mistakes. Yeah, mistakes! They’re a part of every business endeavor, and OnlyFans isn’t excluded. 

When you start reading success stories about top-earning creators, it’s all about the icing on the cake; they probably never let out a few mistakes they made on their way to the top. This alone can ultimately blind intending creators or new models to the mistakes that make many fail on OnlyFans.

This article will reveal the why’s of failing with OnlyFans as well as how to avoid these mistakes that could cost you your OnlyFans career.

Make an appointment now

Reasons Why people fail with OnlyFans

1. Not knowing your audience

OnlyFans promises a load of earning possibilities, and your fans can help you unlock these opportunities if you do it well. Unfortunately, many creators make the mistake of paying little or no attention to what their audience wants. To others, this can be a very rewarding perk. Knowing what your audience wants and providing that which they want is key to a thriving OnlyFans career. 

Consequently, failing could see you lose your most valued asset on this platform. Your fans! They’re more the reason you’re on OnlyFans, and your ideas should have their interests firmly stuffed in them. 

And if it doesn’t, well, you probably guessed that right, you’d lose your followers, and soon, you’re back to your 9-5 job.

2. Failing to Activate your Account

It’s probably less important to note. However, it’s a mistake you should avoid if you actually want to start earning some money on OnlyFans. Creators who just recently joined the platform may become so excited to start making content and earning that they forget to actually activate their account. 

You’re probably asking why activating your account is important. Well, for the bulk of it, not activating your account will mean all your work is useless because your account won’t be available for fans to see. Probably only you!

Suppose you just signed up with OnlyFans as a seller. In that case, you should head to the banking section, fill in your banking details, and conclude the age/identity verification process by providing a photo of your ID and a photo of you holding your ID. By doing this, your account becomes activated, and you can now start creating content.

3. Not knowing where to promote exclusive and NSFW content

As a cam-model or creator just starting out on OnlyFans, it may be exciting to start promoting content as soon as you can and anywhere possible. However, it would be best to be careful with the places you promote your content to avoid getting shadowbanned or suspended entirely.

It’s one reason why many fail with OnlyFans. When creators have put so much work into creating a rich content page and ultimately get banned for a little error; it can cut their OnlyFans dreams short as most of them may give up.

Do well to read up on the terms of use on the platforms you intend to promote your content. Similarly, social media like Instagram, Twitter, and the rest may have tight rules against NSFW content and nudity.

4. Setting the wrong Subscription price or (Moderating too often)

Starting out on OnlyFans can be fun and interesting. However, the fun gains a whole new ground when it’s time to set a price for your content. This part may seem easy to pull off, but you should consider a few things.

Most creators rush off to set a high price because it promises more earnings on their end. However, they don’t consider their fans or subscribers’ opinions when setting overly high prices. Although, it’s actually not big a deal to set a high price if you’re actually offering more than regular creators who just post content every other day.

By this, we mean:

  • Constantly churning out high-quality content (photos and videos)
  • Posting consistently
  • Engaging your audience everywhere possible

If you’re doing this, then it’s probably okay to charge a little high on the subscription. However, not too high to annoy your customers. Additionally, moderating your subscription prices too often or higher when your content basically does not change will leave many of your fans red-faced and forced to quit on you.

5. Waiting to gain a ton of subscribers before posting

Most people do this, and it’s quite obvious why they do it. They don’t have many subscribers or any subscribers at all. Or perhaps, they don’t really dig into how OnlyFans works.

If you’re in this grey area, you must get out of it as quickly as possible.

Waiting to gain a ton of subscribers before posting may seem like the right thing to do, especially for new content models or creators. However, no one’s actually going to subscribe to you if your content space (OnlyFans Page) is EMPTY.

Fans on OnlyFans are there for your content’s fun and excitement, so why would they subscribe to your page if you’ve got nothing on there?

Furthermore, people who haven’t subscribed to your content can already see the number of photos, videos, or content uploaded, and they’re more likely to move away from your page if they find out you’ve got no actual content going.

So, if you want to start reeling in that large number of subscribers, you’ve got to keep up with the posting game.

Gaining subscribers on OnlyFans can be a difficult process, you can Apply now to enlist the aid of an expert OnlyFans agency that will help you reach your subscribers goal in no time.

6. Ignoring your subscribers

So you rolled up a few sleeves and got quite a commendable number of subscribers, and then suddenly, you ghost them. You might have done this if you’re already a creator or model on OnlyFans. Ignoring your subscribers is one thing most creators don’t do intentionally. 

Still, they do not realize the harm they’re doing. Your subscribers are a very pivotal part of your success on the platform, and if you’re going to pass on the fail path, then you should consider engaging them as much as you can.

Try to reply to every message and routinely suggest exclusive content or stuff you feel they’ll be interested in. And if there’s a request that is against your boundaries, you can go ahead and decline the request. It’s better than avoiding them totally.

Make an appointment now

7. Not promoting Enough or At All

Success on OnlyFans is beyond creating content and gaining a handful of subscribers. In fact, if you don’t promote as much, then you’ll probably be stuck trying to reach the 21 subscriber benchmark.

Content creators often neglect promotions, as some even find them useless. This is an obvious reason why many fail on OnlyFans; not keeping up with the promotions and eventually giving up when nothing seems to work anymore.

Promotions are an integral part of OnlyFans content selling, as you need to keep up by bringing in new subscribers if your goal is longevity. Cam models or creators with a social media following can leverage the audience on their social handles to promote their OnlyFans Page. Instagram, Twitter, and even Reddit forums are great places to promote. If you have membership on other Cam sites, this can be a good place to start off as well.

8. Promoting too much

Okay, so it’s already included that not having enough promotions is one mistake creators make. Well, it’s also a thing if you do it too much. If you’re a new creator with several promising promotions, you may be tempted to go all in and just promote everytime.

While it seems like a great idea, you’ll come off as spammy and annoying to people. Soon, you will be marked off as an account not to follow. Additionally, if you promote in this manner on social media pages like Instagram, Twitter, and the likes, then they may actually mistake you as some bot and this could bring up a whole new level of difficulty on your end. 

So while you intend to promote your OnlyFans Page and gain more subscribers, be sure to draw a line between not promoting enough and overpromoting. Endeavor to keep it minimal, at least one promotion post a day can be a sweet spot so you don’t bore your followers with spam.

9. Being inconsistent with your post and fan engagement

We’ve got to admit that content selling on OnlyFans is a lot of work! Having to stay consistent with posts and replying to every PPV message or engaging your fans with live streams and exciting stuff can be quite difficult. But hey, it’s why you signed up, and it won’t do you any good if you aren’t up and doing with your content.

A few new creators may think it’s all blush and bliss until they find out it’s harder to keep up with consistently providing unique and quality content. So they eventually start putting up content once in a while. Unfortunately, you know what’s going to happen? You’re going to lose subscribers faster than you can anticipate. 

It’s a major reason why many fail with OnlyFans. They stop being consistent or aren’t consistent at all. Soon your fan base will find out you’re not offering as much excitement or any excitement at all and will have to move on to the next creator who’s actually going to give them the fun for their money. 

Finding the inspiration to keep up with the endless demands of fans can be difficult. If you’re out of ideas, we can help you! Let a professional agency lift the weight off your shoulders with proven content planning tips and ideas. Apply now to access this offer.

10. Not turning heads with your profile & cover images

It’s one thing to have many subscribers, and it’s another to recruit more subscribers. If you’re after the latter, then you must appeal to potential subscribers with your profile pictures and cover images.

Your cover images or profile photos are the first thing people see when they slide through a list of creators. Typically, you want to make sure your page attracts them rather than your potential subscribers scooting over to the next appealing profile.

This is one mistake intending creators and models make when they just start out on OnlyFans, not setting up a highly appealing and enchanting cover image or profile photo. It’s one of the first reasons why many fail with OnlyFans because they cannot bring in new subscribers. 

To that end, here’s what you can do. First, have one of your best images on display. If you’re a model or cosplay artist, try to showcase your best work here. Chances are, potential fans will see it and most likely subscribe to keep seeing more.

11. Offering free subscriptions when you’re not earning enough

It’s okay to offer a bunch of freebies and free subscriptions to your content. However, if you’re after the money, then you should have a second thought about offering free subscriptions or extras on other services.

Creators often make the mistake of thinking that if they offer a free subscription to gain a considerable number of subscribers, then they can switch up to paid subs out of the blue. While this can be a good content planning and earning strategy, it may also come as a shock to some of the fans who have stuck with your for a while.  

Consequently, you may have a few fans unsubscribe from your page the moment you introduce a paid subscription for your content. So, if you’re offering free subs, stick to that. Otherwise, pull up a paid subscription from the initial.

Make an appointment now

12. Not suggesting tips

If you’re going to last on OnlyFans, then you’ve got to recruit every strategy and earning opportunity within your grasp or you may end up as a creator who nags and wails over their failure in Reddit forums and social media comment boxes. 

One thing that often sets high earners aside is tips! It may come off as weird or shameful, but many top earners suggest tips from their fans, which is normal. Chances are that if you have a loyal fan base and subscribers, they’ll happily leave something for you. You just have to make a suggestion or request it.

13. Tipping too high or not setting top suggestion

This is often a huge mistake a few creators make when they put out a new post. Tip suggestion! Whenever you put up a post, OnlyFans provides you with the option to set up a “tip suggestion.” This basically demands extra from your fans for very unique or quality content. It may seem a little too much to include a tip suggestion when your fans are already subscribed to your content, but it’s totally okay. 

You probably put more time into making that particular content, and your fans can throw a little appreciation your way by leaving a tip. Also, tipping too high can be awfully repelling. It’s okay to suggest a tip but tipping too high can annoy your fans rather than the intended idea. 

Tips start from $5 minimum and can be set to any amount above that. Do well to moderate these prices to something your fans can easily spare.

14. Expecting speedy success

OnlyFans requires patience and dedication. From setting up a top-notch profile to building a rich fanbase, it will take loads of patience and time. Although It’s okay to expect quick success as most top earners and successful OnlyFans creators have probably made you believe. However, placing your expectations on a quicker outcome can eventually turn out sour when it doesn’t go the way you anticipated. Worst still, you may give up before your plans start falling into place.

Give it time and understand that hundreds of people are offering the same content as you, and it’s going to take time to actually gain a reputation and start reeling in some good cash.

15. Not Hiring an expert OnlyFans agency

There are over a million creators and models like you on OnlyFans constantly tweaking their strategies and setting a fierce competition. For a model or creator just getting acquainted with OnlyFans, we’d say your odds of reaching that top earner’s rating are quite slim if you’re just going to sit down and hope for the best. OnlyFans require a lot of work and experience. You can either work your way up slowly or recruit an expert OnlyFans agency to help you.

With a wealth of experience and impeccable content planning strategy, you can reach all your OnlyFans goals in no time. Apply now to kickstart a successful OnlyFans career immediately.
